title: Raigad Fort
subtitle: The Capital of the Maratha Empire
overview: Raigad Fort, located in the Raigad district of Maharashtra, was the capital of the Maratha Empire under the rule of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Built at a height of around 2,700 feet above sea level, it offers a commanding view of the Sahyadri mountain range.

The fort is renowned for its architectural brilliance, strategic location, and historical importance. It served as the coronation site of Shivaji Maharaj in 1674 and is often referred to as the 'Gibraltar of the East'.

highlights.title: Capital of Maratha Empire
highlights.description: Raigad was the capital of the Maratha Empire and the coronation site of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

highlights.title: Majestic Hill Fort
highlights.description: Perched 2,700 feet high, Raigad offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys and mountains.

geography.intro: Situated in the Sahyadri range of the Western Ghats, Raigad Fort is strategically placed on a hilltop, making it almost invincible during its time.

climate.description: Raigad experiences tropical climate with pleasant winters, warm summers, and heavy monsoon rains.

seasons.text: Best visited between October and February.
Monsoon adds lush greenery but makes trekking slippery.

geography.conclusion: Its altitude and rugged terrain made Raigad one of the most secure forts of the Marathas, with breathtaking natural surroundings.

activities.title: Trekking to Raigad
activities.description: A moderately challenging trek leading through scenic ghats, taking about 1.5 to 2 hours.
info: Use the main route from Pachad village.
Cable car facility also available for quick ascent.

activities.title: Photography & Sunset Views
activities.description: Capture stunning sunsets and panoramic views of the Sahyadri ranges.
info: Best views from Hirkani Buruj and Queen’s Palace area.
Morning and evening light ideal for photography.

activities.title: Explore Historical Sites
activities.description: Visit the palace ruins, market area, Jagdishwar Temple, and Shivaji’s Samadhi.
info: Each section reveals Maratha history and architecture.
Audio guides available near main entrance.

attractions.title: Jagdishwar Temple
attractions.description: The temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, believed to be Chhatrapati Shivaji’s family deity.

attractions.title: Hirkani Buruj
attractions.description: A bastion with a famous legend of a brave mother who descended the fort’s cliff to reach her child.

marineLife.intro: Being a hill fort, Raigad does not have marine life. However, the region’s ecosystem is rich in flora and fauna typical to the Western Ghats.

items.title: Flora
items.description: Dense vegetation including mango, tamarind, and teak trees along with wild shrubs.

items.title: Fauna
items.description: Includes monkeys, peacocks, hornbills, and various species of reptiles.

conclusion: The biodiversity adds natural charm to the historical ambience.
Nature enthusiasts enjoy the serene and green environment year-round.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Regular trains from Mumbai and Pune.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Easily accessible from Mahad, 25 km away.
MSRTC buses and private taxis available from Pune and Mumbai.

bookingTips.description: Plan your visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid heat and crowds.
Carry water, snacks, and proper footwear for trekking.
Don’t miss the cable car ride for aerial views of the fort.
